nodes.body: Zulip discussion: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Banach.20Tarski.20Paradox.20in.20Lean
maintainer merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8809718239/job/24180976082)

Thanks! I'm looking forward to seeing the API around this develop.

bors merge
I think there's a few issues here that still need resolving.

Thanks! I'm looking forward to seeing the API around this develop.

bors merge
I wonder whether it would be better to have `specialUnitaryGroup` be a submonoid of `Matrix n n α` (like `unitaryGroup`), to avoid this nested subtype annoyance?
How would you implement this?
One option would be `unitaryGroup n α ⊓ MonoidHom.mker detMonoidHom`.
How would I create an element with this approach?
I haven't tested this, but probably `⟨A, h1, h2⟩` where `h1` is a proof that `A` is unitary and `h2` is a proof that `A` is special.
Thank you very much

It seems that this typeclass assumption is unused.
```suggestion
variable (n) (α : Type v) [CommRing α] [StarRing α] {A : Matrix n n α}
```

I added it because the people in [this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Odd.20Fintype) and in [this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Banach.20Tarski.20Paradox.20in.20Lean) zulip thread said that we need to assume that 2 is invertible in order to define it as the kernel of the determinant
But currently I don't think that you are actually assuming that 2 is invertible. You just have an unused typeclass assumption floating around.
How can I specify this assumption then, should I add it directly in front of the definition?

That would work, except that the linter will complain that the assumption is unused :)

Personally, I think that it's simplest just to drop the assumption for now, mention in the docstring that the definition isn't quite right in characteristic 2, and add the assumption later whenever it's needed in a proof.
Ok, if this will go through...

I would expect a lemma with this name to say that `A` is special unitary if and only if `A` is unitary and has determinant `1`. Then you could add a followup lemma for the special case where `A` is already known to be unitary (maybe called `unitary_mem_specialUnitaryGroup_iff`).
Ok, the follow up lemma could be the subject for another PR....
Can you make sure that `n` and `α` are implicit in this theorem?

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · rintro ⟨h1, h2⟩ ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · rintro ⟨h1, h2⟩ ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · apply mem_unitaryGroup_iff.mpr ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · exact h2 ```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  rw [← mem_unitaryGroup_iff]
  rfl
```
If you made `n`, `α`, and `β` implicit (using curly braces after the abbrev), then this could be `exact` rather than `apply`.

How would I do this?
`abbrev specialUnitaryGroup {n : Type u} {α : Type v} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n] [CommRing α] [StarRing α]
  := unitaryGroup n α ⊓ MonoidHom.mker detMonoidHom` This gives me errors in the next lemma

Sorry, I meant that you should make `n`, `α`, and `β` implicit a line or two after the `abbrev`. That way they are explicit for the definition but implicit theorems where they can be inferred from `A`.

For example:
```
section specialUnitaryGroup

variable (n) (α)

/--`Matrix.specialUnitaryGroup` is the group of unitary `n` by `n` matrices where the determinant
is 1. (This definition is only correct if 2 is invertible.)-/
abbrev specialUnitaryGroup := unitaryGroup n α ⊓ MonoidHom.mker detMonoidHom

variable {n} {α}

theorem mem_specialUnitaryGroup_iff :
    A ∈ specialUnitaryGroup n α ↔ A * star A = 1 ∧ A.det = 1:= by
  rw [← mem_unitaryGroup_iff]
  rfl

end specialUnitaryGroup
```
Ok, thank you very much for this help

If you use `#where`, you can see that you already have `{A : Matrix n n α}` sitting around.
```suggestion
variable {n} {α}
```
ohh ok, I did not know about that, interesting

```suggestion
theorem mem_specialUnitaryGroup_iff :
```

```suggestion
    specialOrthogonalGroup n β :=
  ⟨A, (mem_orthogonalGroup_iff' n β).mpr h1, h2⟩
```

I think this should be definitional. There's no reason to pick a direction here (i.e., `A * star A` vs. `star A * A`)
```suggestion
    A ∈ specialUnitaryGroup n α ↔ A ∈ unitaryGroup n α ∧ A.det = 1 :=
  Iff.rfl
```

Same here
```suggestion
    A ∈ specialOrthogonalGroup n β ↔ A ∈ orthogonalGroup n β ∧ A.det = 1 :=
  Iff.rfl
```

```suggestion
/-- Given an orthogonal matrix with the determinant 1, we get an instance of
```

I don't entirely see the point of this `def`, especially not without `@[simps]`; I think it's only going to erect barriers. But more importantly, it again suffers from the problem of choosing sides (i.e., `star A * A = 1` versus `A * star A = 1`). And the version that just assumes `A ∈ orthogonalGroup n β` is truly unnecessary.
Ok thank you for the remarks, I'm just gonna remove it then
